column4: does anyone know anything about how i can enable pae so i can use all 8 gigs of my ram?
what do you have against 64 bit linux?
nothing in general
it just wasnt for me
maybe i didnt give it enough of a chance, but maybe im jus right
i only switched thinking that bluetooth would work, which it didnt.
nd now im back in 32 but land trying to get this back the way i had it originally
I don't understand, 64 vs 32 shouldn't affect bluetooth drivers?
well i didnt know that
my bluetooth works in windows
just not in ubuntu
my bluetooth works in windows, jus not in ubuntu
right, this has nothing to do with 64 vs 32 bit linux, just install 64 bit and enjoy the extra ram. Not to mention the big speed increase in some CPU heavy tasks
i did that already, i did not like it.
did not like what? 64 bit ubuntu? There isn't really a User interface difference or anything. You can still run 32 bit applications anyways.
it just didnt work better for me
im  better off in 32 bit land
with my pae enabled
I still don't understand. Bluetooth somehow worked in 32 bit and not 64 bit?
no it doesnt work in either
but there was no big speed increase in 64 either
in fact, i believe my 32 bit install with the pae enabled was faster
so what do you have against 64 bit linux then? It will enable you to use 8GB of RAM natively and increase performance in some applications. What's not to like?
